images.title: Graham Horn / Corton Gorse
images.caption: Corton Gorse. The name given to this area if not this field on the 1:25K map on which the isolated trees in the middle are also shown. The west side of Corton Ridge is cattle grassland running steeply down to Sutton Farm (just in the north-west corner of the square) seen in the background.

images.title: Mike Searle / Holway
images.caption: Holway. Small hamlet to the east of Sandford Orcas.

images.title: Sarah Smith / Church path - Corton Denham
images.caption: Church path - Corton Denham. St Andrew's church is situated at the top of the village on the hillside. The old path is steep and made up of small cobble stones. At the bottom the junction of Putts Lane with Middle Ridge Lane disappearing further down the hill is just visible.

description: This Somerset based village is a nice place to start a walk with two significant waymarked trails passing through the settlement. This route uses sections of the Macmillan Way and the Monarch's Way to create a circular walk around the village. On the way you'll visit the scenic Corton Ridge and the neighbouring Sandford Orcas with its impressive manor house. The walk starts in the village and heads west along Ridge Lane to link up with the Monarch's Way. Follow the waymarked footpath south and it will take you along the Corton Ridge towards Stafford's Green Farm. The route then continues to Sandford Orcas Manor House. You continue south to Higher Sandford before turning north to Holway and Stafford's Green with Poyntington Down to your east. You then past the Wheat Sheaf Hill Reservoir before returning to Corton Denham.
